node.title: Pushpay Holdings receives unsolicited offers to buy the businesses
node.description: The mobile donations company appointed a financial advisor after receiving the unsolicited offers to purchase the firm.

node.title: Revamped guide helps businesses calculate climate emissions
node.description: The Environment Ministry has released an updated guide to help organisations and businesses measure and report their climate emissions.

node.title: Mount Ruapehu enters fifth week of raised volcanic activity
node.description: Elevated volcanic unrest on Mount Ruapehu has entered its fifth week with strong tremors, gas outputs and heat-flow into the crater lake.

node.title: Biden discusses immigration issues with Congressional Hispanic Caucus
node.description: Biden also told Hispanic lawmakers he's looking at options to forgive most student debt for those with federally-backed loans.

node.title: Court action over Auckland Transport plan's predicted emissions
node.description: Climate and transport advocates are taking Auckland Transport and Auckland Council to the High Court for adopting a transport plan they say will fail to result in a meaningful reduction in emissions.

node.title: Coach optimistic about Gordon's recovery
node.description: Silver Ferns midcourter Maddy Gordon is making an impact as she returns to the ANZ netball premiership from a serious knee injury.

node.title: Elon Musk to buy Twitter for $44b
node.description: Twitter initially rebuffed Musk's bid, but it will now ask shareholders to vote to approve the US$44 billion deal.

node.title: Teens could fail basic literacy, numeracy NCEA standards - report
node.description: Some teens could fail compulsory qualification standards for not knowing how to use capital letters or full stops, and not knowing how many minutes in an hour.

node.title: Great Walks celebrate 30th anniversary with bookings set to open
node.description: New Zealand's Great Walks are celebrating their 30th anniversary this year, with the 2022-23 booking season opening next week.

node.title: Speed limit changes could hit all Hawke's Bay highways
node.description: Speed limits across the entire highway network in Hawke's Bay could be dropped, as well as in parts of its bordering regions.

node.title: Police appeal for sightings of missing fisherman's possessions
node.description: Police are appealing for sightings of items of interest as they review the next stage in a search for a missing fisher in the Eastern Bay of Plenty.

node.title: Anzac weekend toll: Police call for safe behaviour on roads
node.description: Police say it has been a heartbreaking Anzac weekend on the road and is unacceptable that 11 lives were lost over a few days. Audio

node.title: Councillor steps aside after cancer diagnosis
node.description: Wellington City councillor Sean Rush will take medical leave after being diagnosed with early-stage bowel cancer.

node.title: Explaining Putin’s grip on power
node.description: Why do the majority of Russians back the actions of their strongman leader Vladimir Putin? As The Detail finds out, the answer goes back centuries.

node.title: Scrapped harbour crossing plan leaves Northcote residents in limbo
node.description: Residents whose homes were purchased for a now-scrapped plan to build a cycling bridge over the Waitematā Harbour want answers from the Transport Agency.

node.title: New body cam footage shows moments after fatal "Rust" shooting
node.description: Baldwin is seen telling two officers after the shooting that he didn't pull the trigger of the 45-caliber prop gun while rehearsing the scene.

node.title: Funding announced for pest control, revegetation jobs
node.description: More than 50 nature-based jobs are being created in Auckland as part of the region's Covid-19 recovery.

node.title: 'Beautiful, talented, caring' - tributes flow for killed Southland teens
node.description: The four teens who died in a horror crash in Invercargill on Friday are being remembered by loved ones and their community.

node.title: Second port worker death reinforces need for inquiry - unions
node.description: The death of a Lyttelton port worker - the second port fatality in a week - is further evidence of the need for an urgent inquiry into port safety, unions say. Audio

node.title: Trump held in contempt by New York court over documents
node.description: A New York judge held Donald Trump in contempt of court for not producing subpoenaed documents of his business practices, and fined him $10,000 per day until he complies.

node.title: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signs bill creating election police unit
node.description: At a bill signing ceremony Monday at a sports bar in Spring Hill, Florida, DeSantis suggested that existing law enforcement may not be equipped or willing to thoroughly investigate fraud cases.

node.title: Red Bull plane crashes after failed stunt attempt
node.description: The other pilot regained control of the second plane and landed safely.

node.title: Judge to block U.S. border officials from ending Title 42 policy
node.description: Since its inception in March 2020, the Title 42 authority has allowed U.S. authorities along the Mexican border to expel migrants over 1.8 million times to Mexico.

node.title: Flexi-wage jobs scheme falls short by nearly half
node.description: The government's Flexi-wage scheme is well off track if it wants to get 40,000 people off a benefit and into a job in two years, National says.

node.title: Supreme Court to hear case over "Remain in Mexico" rule for asylum-seekers
node.description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday will hear arguments in a case that could determine whether the Biden administration can terminate the so-called "Remain in Mexico" policy​.

node.title: D.C. shooter fired overn 200 rounds and had 800 more, police say
node.description: "These are not inexpensive firearms," MPD Chief Robert Contee said Monday. "And we want to get to the bottom of that."

node.title: South Africa's Graeme Smith cleared of racism allegations
node.description: Former South Africa director of cricket Graeme Smith has been cleared of racism allegations by two independent arbitrators.

node.title: JCPenny offers $8.6 billion to acquire rival Kohl's: report
node.description: Kohl's shares rose more than 4% on the news Monday.

node.title: Labour called to clarify position on Rotorua electoral rules
node.description: The National Party wants Labour to clarify if it will continue to support a bill which would change Rotorua's electoral rules, despite warnings from the attorney general.

node.title: U.S. launches online portal for sponsoring Ukrainian refugees
node.description: U.S. citizens or groups can now file applications to show they can financially support displaced Ukrainians seeking to come to the U.S.
